revised_title: Investigation of Crystal Deformation and Abrasion in Copper and Iron
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the deformation of copper and iron crystals by unidirectional abrasion. They discovered that the crystals experienced significant rotation and deformation in the surface regions, with some parts rotating by up to 90 degrees. The deformation caused by abrasion is similar to the development of "deformation bands." This research contributes to the understanding of materials science and surface science.
